isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH TWO CYLINDER RECIPROCATING TYPE - BEFORE 01/01/1993 (R-12) - REMOVE AND INSTALL - COMPRESSOR

step1.para: Before starting removal of the compressor, the refrigerant must be recovered from the system. A Recovery/ Recycling Station or equivalent is required for this operation.

The manifold gauge set and/or recovery/recycling station and service hoses MUST BE DEDICATED to and used only on one of the two types of refrigerant. If the oil that is in the hoses and gauges used to service an R-12 charged air conditioning system is introduced into an HFC-134A charged air conditioning system, the oil from the R-12 manifold gauge set and hoses will cause the HFC-134A system to function poorly and eventually may cause compressor failure. The same thing will happen if HFC-134A oil is introduced into an R-12 system. Do not use the same manifold gauge set, recovery/recycling station and service hoses on both R-12 and HFC-134A SYSTEMS.

Remove the caps from the compressor service ports and connect the Manifold and Gauge Set. Make sure that both hand valves are fully off by turning each one fully clockwise. Start with the blue manifold suction gauge hose and connect it to the compressor suction service port. Connect the red hose from the manifold discharge gauge to the high pressure discharge service port.
On HFC-134A Metric SAE quick- disconnect fittings, turn the valves on the red and blue hoses completely off (turn clockwise).

note.para: Service ports are usually marked on the compressor head. If the marking is not visible, you can identify the suction (low pressure) side by the larger diameter system hose connected at the compressor.

important.para: The fittings on the service hoses for HFC-134A air conditioning systems are standard Metric SAE quick- disconnect fittings that will work only on HFC-134A air conditioning systems.

step1.para: Connect hose ( Yellow) to center fitting on the manifold and position opposite end of hose to the inlet of the Recovery/ Recycling Station.
On HFC-134A Metric SAE quick- disconnect fittings, turn the valves on the red and blue hoses completely on (turn counterclockwise).

Open both valves of the manifold. Turn the main power switch on and press the compressor start switch. The Recovery/ Recycling Station will automatically shut off when the refrigerant in the system has been exhausted to the storage tank.

warning.para: Be certain that the yellow system service hose is firmly attached to the inlet of the Recovery/ Recycling Station. Refrigerant can be hazardous if inhaled.

caution.para: Do not vent refrigerant into the atmosphere. The use of R-12 is a worldwide environmental concern. Legislation has been enacted that makes the use of Recovery/Recycling Stations mandatory. Because of the absence of chlorine in the molecular structure of HFC-134A, the use of HFC-134A refrigerant will not have any harmful effects on the ozone layer of the atmosphere. Because there is not enough evidence to determine the "greenhouse" effect of HFC-134A, recycling of HFC-134A is recommended.

step1.para: Once the refrigerant has been recovered, remove the compressor by removing the refrigerant hoses and service port gaskets. Then loosen the four mounting bolts, and remove the drive belt and the electric clutch wire from the connector.

The compressor can now be removed from the vehicle. Compressor mounting brackets vary from one vehicle to another ( Figure 4, Figure 5, Figure 6, Figure 7, Figure 8, Figure 9 and Figure 10); however, the compressor always has a four-bolt mounting and almost always a supporting brace.

important.para: When removing the compressor, be certain to seal all openings to prevent entry of dirt and moisture.

caution.para: Do not invert the compressor beyond a horizontal position during compressor removal or installation as refrigerant oil will leak into the suction cavity. This will result in the piston drawing the oil into the cylinder and damaging the compressor during initial operation after installation.

note.para: Not all parts of the compressor are serviceable. The clutch assembly is replaced as a unit and the compressor seal and valve assemblies are supplied as service kits. More extensive service requirements may necessitate replacement of the compressor.

step1.para: Position the compressor on the mounting bracket and insert the four retaining bolts.
Install the compressor drive belt, align the clutch drive pulley with the accessory drive pulley or water pump pulley and tension the belt as specified in SPECIFICATIONS.
Tighten the compressor mounting bolts to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N•m) and install supporting braces if applicable.
Install the service port gaskets and refrigerant hoses.
Recharge the air conditioning system as specified in GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
